description:
Rokuro Enmado is a young boy who used to be a powerful aspiring exorcist, before a tragic incident left his friend dead and made him abandon the profession. One day, he has a fateful encounter with Benio Adashino, a girl around his age and a well known exorcist from the east. According to prophecy, Rokuro and Benio are the "Twin Star Exorcists", and are destined to marry and have a child which will be the ultimate exorcist, capable of cleansing all evil spirits, or Kegare, from the world.
When Rokuro's best friend Ryogo goes missing, Rokuro is forced to ask Benio for help to enter Magano, the realm of the evil Kegare, to rescue him!

(Source: Wikipedia)
synonyms: ทวิดารา มหาองเมียวจิ

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/210380174)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/210380174)

Freelancer originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).

Married to fellow animator [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

[Official Website](https://iris.dive2ent.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/iris-official-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iris_official_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/iris.dive2.official) | [Ustream](http://www.ustream.tv/user/dive2iRis)

i☆Ris is an idol group formed by Avex in 2012 under the DIVE II Entertainment label. Its members are also seiyuu.

__Members:__
• [Saki Yamakita](https://anilist.co/staff/117183/Saki-Yamakita) (山北早紀) - Color: Green; (leader)
• [Yuu Serizawa](https://anilist.co/staff/116515/Yuu-Serizawa) (芹澤優) -  Color: Blue
• [Himika Akaneya](https://anilist.co/staff/119203/Himika-Akaneya) (茜屋日海夏) - Color: Purple
• [Yuki Wakai](https://anilist.co/staff/122697/Yuki-Wakai) (若井友希) - Color: Red
• [Miyu Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/119204/Miyu-Kubota) (久保田未夢) - Color: Orange
• [Azuki Shibuya](https://anilist.co/staff/126076/Azuki-Shibuya) (澁谷梓希) - Color: Yellow (announced to graduate on March 31st, 2021.)

__[Website](https://itowokashi.jp/) | [Twitter (Kashitaro)](https://twitter.com/kashitaro_ito) | [Twitter (Ryo)](https://twitter.com/LeftyMonsterP) | [NicoNico Profile (Kashitaro)](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/25761100) | [NicoNico Profile (Ryo)](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/24882114)__

__Formed:__ 2012
__Genres:__ J-POP

__Introduction:__
Itowokashi is a Japanese two-man unit consisting of utaite Kashitaro Ito and multi-instrumentalist Ryo "Lefty" Miyata who, with their years of talent and experience, perform with characteristic melodies, carefully woven with touching lyrics and a powerful singing voice that values the Japanese language. They are under record label Avex Trax (2016–).

They are somewhat secretive about their identity and will only reveal it during live performances.

__Biography:__
Since their formation in 2012, they have, in parallel with their band activities, been actively engaged in activities such as posting music online, providing music to various artists, participating in various music production, and attending various supporting acts for other musicians. They have in their time as a duo garnered over 25 million video views on video sharing sites such as Nico Nico and YouTube, while also gaining over 550.000 followers on twitter from lots of fans worldwide.

Because they are a band, when they continued to produce music mainly on online video sites, the duo started to wonder if their music was really reaching everyone from the videos they posted online. They started wondering; "Is the song really reaching everyone?", "Is it grateful to everyone?", "Should we start doing live performances? Because we really want to deliver our music directly to our listeners.", "We want to meet all of you and thank you personally". This led to a change, which especially started happening from 2013, where they would start conducting tours all over the country. They wanted to tour the entirety of Japan to give everyone, especially those in urban areas a chance to see them live, and have since successfully toured in every prefecture.

In addition, the duo has performed in world street live tours internationally in Thailand, Singapore, France and The Netherlands. In Singapore they have also performed twice at certain festivals.

__Members:__
- [Kashitaro Ito](https://anilist.co/staff/157028/Kashitaro-Ito) (伊東歌詞太郎) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Ryo "Lefty" Miyata](https://anilist.co/staff/180920) (宮田“レフティ”リョウ), more commonly known as LeftyMonsterP – bassist, guitarist, keyboardist and in-charge of arrangement

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88%E3%83%B2%E3%82%AB%E3%82%B7), edited)
Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram Members: - SAKIKA - Vocals, Guitar - NAGISA - Guitar - MINA - Bass - MIREI - Drums

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chau_kotori)

Graduated from Kyoto Seika University in 2012. Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist. Leader and founder of Studio Colorido's Team Yamahitsuji since fall 2018.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).
